com.icfolson.aem.library.api.node

Interface BasicNode

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Accessible, ImageSource, Linkable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    ComponentNode
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelegateComponentNode

    public interface BasicNode
extends Linkable, ImageSource, Accessible
    Represents a "basic" node in the JCR, typically an unstructured node that may or may not exist in a CQ page hierarchy. Examples of non-page descendant nodes that could be considered basic nodes include design nodes and arbitrary unstructured nodes that do not require inheritance capabilities.

    Many methods return an Optional type where a null instance would otherwise be returned (e.g. when a descendant node is requested for a path that does not exist in the repository).

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        String getId()
        Get the unique ID for this resource based on the path. If this node is the descendant of a page, the page path will be removed from the identifier, since the relative path of a component node is always unique for a page.
        Returns:
        unique ID

      • getIndex

        int getIndex()
        Get the index of this resource in relation to sibling nodes.
        Returns:
        index in sibling nodes or -1 if resource is null or has null parent node

      • getIndex

        int getIndex(String resourceType)
        Get the index of this node in relation to sibling nodes, ignoring resource types that do not match the specified value.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - sling:resourceType to filter on
        Returns:
        index in sibling nodes or -1 if resource is null or has null parent node

      • getNode

        Optional<javax.jcr.Node> getNode()
        Get the JCR node for this instance. This will return an absent Optional if the underlying resource for this instance is synthetic or non-existent.
        Returns:
        Optional node for this resource

      • getPath

        String getPath()
        Shortcut for getting the current resource path.
        Returns:
        resource path

      • getProperties

        List<javax.jcr.Property> getProperties(Predicate<javax.jcr.Property> predicate)
                                       throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException
        Get a list of properties that apply for the given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - predicate to apply
        Returns:
        filtered list of properties or empty list if no properties of this node apply for the given predicate
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - if error occurs reading node properties

      • getResource

        Resource getResource()
        Get the underlying resource for this instance.
        Returns:
        current resource
